intro: Mallophyton, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Mallophyton species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. These plants are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their unique appearance and hardy nature.
